question: Which regulator has instructed all financial institutions to implement waiver of interest on interest?
explanation:
The nation’s central Bank, the Reserve Bank of India has asked all lenders (including non-banking financial institutions) to implement the waiver of “interest on interest”.
This would be applicable to loans of up to Rs.2 crore for the 6-month moratorium period beginning March 2020. Home Loan, Education Loans, Vehicle Loan, MSME loans, Consumer durable loans and credit card dues would be covered under this scheme.
